meanings.definition: To mix or stir together haphazardly
meanings.sent1: I like to scramble eggs for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The chef will scramble the ingredients in the pan.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to scramble all the puzzle pieces together for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts began to scramble in her mind as she tried to focus.
meanings.sent5: The artist used bold strokes to scramble the colors on the canvas.

meanings.sent1: The squirrel will scramble up the tree to escape the dog.
meanings.sent2: She had to scramble to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to scramble across the ice but kept slipping.
meanings.sent4: The students had to scramble to finish their project before the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to scramble through the obstacle course to reach the finish line.

meanings.sent1: The scramble of toys on the floor made it hard to walk.
meanings.sent2: The paperwork on his desk was a complete scramble.
meanings.sent3: The costume party turned into a scramble of characters from different eras.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a scramble of thoughts after the surprising news.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting was a beautiful scramble of colors and shapes.
